question: Which of the following statements regarding the powers of the Rajya Sabha are correct?

options.A: Rajya Sabha can authorize Parliament to make laws on subjects in the State List.
options.B: Rajya Sabha can initiate Money Bills.
options.C: Rajya Sabha can remove the Vice President from office.
options.D: Rajya Sabha shares equal power with Lok Sabha in passing ordinary bills.

question: Consider the following statements regarding the President of India:

options.A: The President can dissolve the Lok Sabha at any time at his discretion.
options.B: The President is bound by the advice of the Council of Ministers in exercising most powers.
options.C: The President can return a bill (other than Money Bill) for reconsideration once.
options.D: The President can issue ordinances even when Parliament is in session.

question: Which of the following provisions are part of the Basic Structure of the Indian Constitution as per Supreme Court judgments?
Regarding the Anti-Defection Law under the Tenth Schedule, consider the following:

options.A: A legislator voluntarily giving up party membership attracts disqualification.
options.B: Merger of at least two-thirds of a party’s members exempts them from disqualification.
options.C: Speaker/Chairperson’s decision on disqualification is final and cannot be questioned in court.
options.D: Independent members can join a political party without risk of disqualification.

question: Which of the following statements about Judicial Review in India is correct?

options.A: The Supreme Court can review any law passed by Parliament for constitutionality.
options.B: Judicial Review is explicitly mentioned in the Constitution under Article 32 and Article 226.
options.C: High Courts have power to issue writs for enforcement of Fundamental Rights within their jurisdiction.
options.D: Parliament can remove the Supreme Court's power of Judicial Review by simple majority.

question: Regarding the Finance Commission of India, which statements are correct?

options.A: It is a constitutional body appointed every five years.
options.B: It recommends the distribution of taxes between Centre and States.
options.C: It can legislate on matters relating to state finances.
options.D: It submits its report to the President of India.

question: About the Fundamental Duties under Article 51A, consider:

options.A: They are enforceable by law with penalties for non-compliance.
options.B: They serve as a moral obligation for citizens.
options.C: They were added by the 42nd Amendment in 1976.
options.D: They include promoting harmony and spirit of common brotherhood among citizens.

question: Which of the following are features of the Indian Parliamentary System?

options.A: Collective Responsibility of the Council of Ministers to the Lok Sabha.
options.B: Bicameral legislature with equal powers in all matters.
options.C: Indirect election of the President by an electoral college.

question: Consider the powers of the Union Territories with Legislatures:

options.A: They have the same legislative powers as states under Article 246.
options.B: The Parliament can legislate on any subject for Union Territories.
options.C: Lieutenant Governor can reserve any bill for the President's consideration.

question: Regarding the amendment of the Indian Constitution under Article 368, which statements are correct?

options.A: Parliament can amend any part of the Constitution, including Fundamental Rights.
options.B: Certain amendments require ratification by half of the state legislatures.
options.C: The President can return the amendment for reconsideration.
options.D: Judiciary has no power to review constitutional amendments.
